Title: A balanced measure shows superior performance of pseudobulk methods in single-cell RNA-sequencing analysis
Reply to: A balanced measure shows superior performance of pseudobulk methods in single-cell RNA-sequencing analysis
Nonnegative spatial factorization applied to spatial genomics
Summary: This paper presents nonnegative spatial factorization, a general framework for spatially aware and interpretable dimension reduction for high-dimensional spatial data, and its application to spatial transcriptomics analysis.

Title: Local shape descriptors for neuron segmentation
Summary: During segmentation of neurons in electron microscopy datasets, auxiliary learning via the prediction of local shape descriptors increases efficiency, which is important for the processing of datasets of ever-increasing size.

Title: A flexible cross-platform single-cell data processing pipeline
Summary: As the throughput of single-cell RNA-seq studies increases, there is a need for tools that can make the data analysis steps more streamlined and convenient. Here, the authors develop UniverSC, a tool that unifies single-cell RNA-seq analysis workflows and also facilitates their use for non-experts.

Title: Prediction of designer-recombinases for DNA editing with generative deep learning
Summary: Design of recombinases with new target sites is usually achieved through cycles of directed molecular evolution. Here the authors report Recombinase Generator, RecGen, an algorithm for generation of designer-recombinases; they perform experimental validation to show that this can predict recombinase sequences.

Title: Benchmarking tools for detecting longitudinal differential expression in proteomics data allows establishing a robust reproducibility optimization regression approach
Summary: Longitudinal proteomics holds great promise for biomarker discovery, but the data interpretation has remained a challenge. Here, the authors evaluate several tools to detect longitudinal differential expression in proteomics data and introduce RolDE, a robust reproducibility optimization approach.

Title: Unconstrained generation of synthetic antibody–antigen structures to guide machine learning methodology for antibody specificity prediction
Summary: The Absolut! framework can generate synthetic three-dimensional antibody–antigen structures to assist machine learning and dataset construction for antibody design. Most importantly, the relative machine learning performance learnt on Absolut! datasets is shown to transfer to experimental datasets.

Title: Thousands of human non-AUG extended proteoforms lack evidence of evolutionary selection among mammals
Summary: Analysis of a large number of Ribo-seq datasets and genomic alignments led to detection of novel non-AUG proteoforms. Unexpectedly the number of non-AUG proteoforms identified with Ribo-seq greatly exceeds those with strong phylogenetic support.

Title: Single-sequence protein structure prediction using supervised transformer protein language models
Summary: In this study, a supervised protein language model is proposed to predict protein structure from a single sequence. It achieves state-of-the-art accuracy on orphan proteins and is competitive with other methods on human-designed proteins.
